chapter.title: 组织测试
chapter.para:
Test Suite （测试套件）
PHPUnit 的目标之一（参见）是测试应当可组合：我们希望能将任意数量的测试以任意组合方式运行，例如，整个项目的所有测试，或者项目中的某个组件内的所有类的测试，又或者仅仅某单个类的测试。
PHPUnit 支持好几种不同的方式来组织测试以及将它们编排组合成测试套件。本章介绍了最常用的方法。

section.title: 用文件系统来编排测试套件
section.para: 编排测试套件的各种方式中，最简单的大概就是把所有测试用例源文件放在一个测试目录中。通过对测试目录进行递归遍历，PHPUnit 能自动发现并运行测试。

Lets take a look at the test suite of the Object_Freezer library. Looking at this project's directory structure, we see that the test case classes in the Tests directory mirror the package and class structure of the System Under Test (SUT) in the Object directory:
section.screen: Object Tests |-- Freezer |-- Freezer | |-- HashGenerator | |-- HashGenerator | | `-- NonRecursiveSHA1.php | | `-- NonRecursiveSHA1Test.php | |-- HashGenerator.php | | | |-- IdGenerator | |-- IdGenerator | | `-- UUID.php | | `-- UUIDTest.php | |-- IdGenerator.php | | | |-- LazyProxy.php | | | |-- Storage | |-- Storage | | `-- CouchDB.php | | `-- CouchDB | | | | |-- WithLazyLoadTest.php | | | | `-- WithoutLazyLoadTest.php | |-- Storage.php | |-- StorageTest.php | `-- Util.php | `-- UtilTest.php `-- Freezer.php `-- FreezerTest.php
section.para: To run all tests for the library we just need to point the PHPUnit command-line test runner to the test directory:
section.screen:
phpunit Tests PHPUnit 3.8.0 by Sebastian Bergmann.
............................................................ 60 / 75 ...............
Time: 0 seconds
OK (75 tests, 164 assertions)

note.para: If you point the PHPUnit command-line test runner to a directory it will look for *Test.php files.

section.para: To run only the tests that are declared in the Object_FreezerTest test case class in Tests/FreezerTest.php we can use the following command:
section.screen:
phpunit Tests/FreezerTest PHPUnit 3.8.0 by Sebastian Bergmann.
............................
Time: 0 seconds
OK (28 tests, 60 assertions)
section.para: For more fine-grained control of which tests to run we can use the --filter switch:
section.screen:
phpunit --filter testFreezingAnObjectWorks Tests PHPUnit 3.8.0 by Sebastian Bergmann.
.
Time: 0 seconds
OK (1 test, 2 assertions)

note.para: A drawback of this approach is that we have no control over the order in which the test are run. This can lead to problems with regard to test dependencies, see . In the next section you will see how you can make the test execution order explicit by using the XML configuration file.
